availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Jacob Walker (Carter County, KY, farmhand & sgt 22nd KY Inf)

body.p: Carter County, Kentucky, farmhand and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of John Walker and Olivia Walker. Student in Carter County in 1850. Student in Carter County in 1860. Farmhand in Carter County in 1860. Served in the 22nd Kentucky Volunteer Infantry as sergeant from January 10, 1862 to December 10, 1862. Discharged for disability on December 10, 1862.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Carter County, District 1, p. 284B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Carter County, p. 279.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 120-21.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 491 .
